means: 出租汽车( taxi的名词复数 )

word_mean: ［希］趋性：能动生物体在某种外部刺激下发生的定向运动，它可以是正性的(即趋向刺激物)，也可以是负性的(离开刺激物)。-taxis亦可作为后缀，而由词干提示该剌激的性质，如stereotaxis(趋实体性，立体导向)。整复(法)：手法施力使脱位的器官或组织结构复位，如骨折或关节脱位的整复，疝内容(如肠)的还纳复位
接近或离开一个刺激源的定向运动，依据刺激源的性质可区分为趋光性、趋地性、趋触性和趋流性等。

sentence.Network_en: Taxis must conform to the rigorous standards laid down by the police.
sentence.Network_cn: 出租车必须遵守警方的严格规定。

sentence.Network_en: Laura flits about New York hailing taxis at every opportunity.
sentence.Network_cn: 劳拉穿梭于纽约各处，一有机会就打车。
打表计价的出租车相对便宜。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 趋性（Taxis）就是对某种刺激进行趋向或背向的有定向的活动。刺激物可有多种多样，如热、光、化学物质等等，因而趋性也就有趋 …
趋向性(taxis)是一生物(或细胞)天生的行为反应,指其对一指向性刺激(由特定方向给的刺激),而会有趋进(正趋向性)或远离(负趋向性)刺激源的动作。趋向性和.
tautonym 种属同名taxis 窃taxon 分类群
taxis 分类,归类,小队,分队 taxology 分类学 taxonomy 分类学,动植物分类系统,生物分类学你会想到他们之间有密切联系吗?他们都是在词典中紧挨着的单词,老死不.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (in sense 1): from Greek, literally arrangement', from tassein 'arrange'. Sense 2 dates from the late 19th cent

entry.def: A taxi is a car driven by a person whose job is to take people where they want to go in return for money.

example.ex: The taxi drew up in front of the Riviera Club...
example.tran: 出租车在里维埃拉俱乐部门口停了下来。

entry.def: When an aircraft taxis along the ground, or when a pilot taxis a plane somewhere, it moves slowly along the ground.

example.ex: She gave permission to the plane to taxi into position and hold for takeoff...
example.tran: 她发出指令，允许飞机滑行入位，准备起飞。

example.ex: The pilot taxied the plane to the end of the runway.
example.tran: 飞行员将飞机滑行到了跑道尽头。

means.word_mean: 1. a locomotor response toward or away from an external stimulus by a motile (and usually simple) organism
2. the surgical procedure of manually restoring a displaced body part

Sentence.sentence: The dry statistics ought to inform the ongoing deficit debate, because a budget is not just a catalog of programs and taxes.

Piling on higher taxes won't help, "If higher taxes make it more expensive to raise children," says Nicholas Eberstadt of the American Enterprise Institute, "people will think twice about having another child.
